duties_responsibilities.duty: Troubleshoot and repair residential and commercial burglar alarms, fire alarms, video systems, and access control.
Assist installation and inspection departments with troubleshooting, programming, and commissioning systems.
Communicate with clients and co-workers in a professional manner.
Manage daily appointment schedule and paperwork accurately and on time utilizing computers, smartphones, tablets, and other devices.
Maintain accurate vehicle inventory levels to minimize return visits.
Maintain job sites and vehicles in a clean and organized manner.
Must exhibit a positive, team-minded attitude.
Proficient at reading prints, drawings, and schematics.
Strong computer and networking knowledge desired. Understanding of network topology, port forwarding, and configuring IP addresses, routers, and POE switches a plus.
Ability to obtain a Delaware Alarm Employee license (background check).
3 years of industry-related experience or similar trades.
Excellent people skills to interface with clients as well as co-workers.
Ability to pass a drug test.
Requires a valid driver's license and safe driving record.
Ability to use ladders, hand, and power tools in a safe manner following all applicable codes and site-specific requirements.

education_certification.credential: Ability to obtain a Delaware Alarm Employee license (background check).
